item.title: A concurrent resolution honoring the life and work of Mr. Fred McFeely Rogers.

latestAction.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3205)

item.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3204-3205; text as passed Senate: CR S3204-3205; text of measure as introduced: CR S3202)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S3204-3205; text as passed Senate: CR S3204-3205; text of measure as introduced: CR S3202)

summary.text: Honors the life of Fred McFeely Rogers and recognizes him for dedicating his career to the educational children's program "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood."

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on March 5, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Honors the life of Fred McFeely Rogers and recognizes him for dedicating his career to the educational children's program "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood."

bill.title: A concurrent resolution honoring the life and work of Mr. Fred McFeely Rogers.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
